Subject: [ETS] Firmware syncing vs. device enrollment
Description__c:
Some representatives of our customer have noticed dependence/regularity described below. Thus our customer would like to get from us information if this observation is indeed true and can be expected in similar situations. Or maybe it was just an occasional coincidence.

 

Sometimes when admin attempts to select a firmware in a campaign in E-FOTA console, the message "Firmware syncing. You will be notified when it's completed." appears (the file is attached). If at the same time (i.e. when "Firmware syncing..." message is displayed in E-FOTA console) somebody tries to enroll to E-FOTA a new device of the model for which "firmware syncing" is in progress, the process on a device takes a lot of time, much more than normally. It seems like enrolling is affected by firmware syncing.

 

Is this a correct observation? I.e. should one expect slowness of enrolling when "firmware syncing" is in progress? And in consequence, should one avoid enrolling new devices when "firmware syncing" is in progress?

Subject: Device unrecoverable after allowFirmwareRecovery(false) and installing update via Downloadmode
Description__c:
Hi,

 

We are interested in learning a bit more about the expected behavior of the allowFirmwareRecovery API (https://docs.samsungknox.com/devref/knox-sdk/reference/com/samsung/android/knox/restriction/RestrictionPolicy.html#allowFirmwareRecovery(boolean) ).

 

When testing the API we have done and seen the following:

 

  1. call allowFirmwareRecovery(false)
  2. attempt to install a firmware update via download mode. This fails and we get the message "MDM MODE. CAN'T DOWNLOAD".
  3. Restart the device. This triggers a boot loop and we are not able to start the device properly again. We also cannot enter recovery mode again. We have been able to get the device to download mode and then we see the message "Secure JTAG is disabled".

 

Questions:

A. Is it expected that calling allowFirmwareRecover(false) and then attempting to install a firmware update via download mode will put the device in an unrecoverable state?

B. Is there any way to reset the device into a working state?


Device: SM-G980F/DS

Android version: 12

Subject: Firmware upgrade using API results in reboot after 1h and firmware is still on old version
Description__c:
We have an OTA firmware upgrade feature in our Digital Signage solution kompas.


We use the following B2B API for this:


const fwUpdatePromise = new Promise((resolve, reject) => {

b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(

"0",

path.basename(firmware.url), // T-MSMLWWC_1270.1.bem

firmware.version, // T-MSMLWWC 1270.1

firmware.url, // https://server.example.com/T-MSMLWWC_1270.1.bem

firmware.size, // 1151772856

() => {

resolve();

},

(error: any) => {

reject(new Error(error));

},

);

});


This works fine with several models having Tizen 4.0 and Tizen 6.5.


But this specific Tizen 5.0 screen behaves as follows, when trying to upgrade to firmware version "T-MSMLWWC 1270.1" from "T-MSMLWWC-1200.2":


  • updateFirmware() call succeeds
  • after about 1 hour the screen reboots
  • but the firmware is still on the old version
  • webserver access log does not show any GET request on the BEM file


The screen is located at our customers location, so we currently don't have any developer / debug access to the device.


Do you have any advice what's probably going wrong and what we could do better?


Thanks!

Subject: Suddenly a Samsung Flip LH75WMAWLGCXEN, equipped with the latest 1250.2 firmware, has mirroring problems.
Description__c:
Problem:

Suddenly a Samsung Flip LH75WMAWLGCXEN, equipped with the latest 1250.2 firmware, has mirroring problems.

- If we search the Flip from a Windows computer to use it as a wireless display via Miracast protocol, the detection fails.

- If, on the other hand, we use SmartView+ between the Flip and the computer, mirroring is possible but the mouse pointer is unusable due to latency and screen multiplication. It seems mainly accentuated while using Office programmes, less so while viewing other animations such as videos.

- Mirroring from Android smartphones starts well, but then stops after a few seconds for no apparent reason.

- The connection between Flip and computer via HDMI works fine.

 

TBS:

Situation persists whether the Flip is connected to the company Wi-Fi network or tethering from a smartphone. Other Flip in the same office works correctly with the same computers and smartphones.

Standard reset and factory reset have not resolved, browsing via Tizen internet browser seems to work correctly.

 

Repair:

Yesterday 08/06/2023 the service centre intervened onsite replacing main board and Wi-Fi, then performed Factory reset and new firmware update, but problems persist identical. Product Specialist Samsung Italia RP has authorised the closure of the intervention and the opening of this ticket to investigate the software side by analysing the logs, since the problem seems to be related to what is displayed on the screen.

 

Attachments:

- DxDiag file and screenshoot of the cmd after launching netsh wlan show driver command of a computer used for testing before the repair on 08/06/2023;

- Video of the problem, taken before repair on 08/06/2023;

- Photo of multiple mouse on screen after repair on 08/06/2023;

Subject: "Postpone" update policy
Description__c:
Hi Samsung!


We have an ongoing issue with controlling FOTA updates of Samsung devices in our company. 


We are using Microsoft Intune and we use "Postponed" policy for the system updates in the Android configuration profile.


This option, however, does not work - the end user is unable to postpone the Android update. Because of that, we have a maintenance window set in the update policy, as a temporary workaround.


We contacted Microsoft's unified support regarding the issue and their statement was that Samsung affirmed the problem and will roll out the fix for all Samsung models with the August update.


Therefore, could you please confirm that statement and if the August release of the fix is now sure for all Samsung devices eligible for OS update.

Android DO enrollment

All Android versions

Subject: [FER][ETS] Allow a camaign to start with Firmware Any/Latest instead of default Locked firmware
Description__c:

Subject: System update behavior questions
Description__c:
Hi,


Opening the ticket to continue the conversation about system updates and how we can provide better support for customers that need to avoid random restarts due to system update policy.


As a recap from the sync on 11/21/2023:

  • Intune built a system update compliance policy based on the system update info from AM API (https://developers.google.com/android/management/reference/rest/v1/enterprises.devices#systemupdateinfo). This compliance policy lets admins send a notification to devices which have a pending system update, which prompts users to update their device
  • We're still confirming with Google whether the update status they report includes mainline updates in addition to "regular" system updates in system settings.

While building the system update compliance policy, we added a button from the Intune app that attempts to deeplink directly to the system update page in system settings, using a snippet of code like this:


context.startActivity(Intent("android.settings.SYSTEM_UPDATE_SETTINGS"))


where the string constant comes from core/java/android/provider/Settings.java - platform/frameworks/base - Git at Google (googlesource.com). However, we see that this doesn't link to Samsung's system update page.


I've attached some screenshots of what the customer is seeing - 03.jpg is the screen that the above code snippet links to, which doesn't show any updates. However, if the user navigates to Settings -> Software update -> Download and install, they do see an update (show in images 10 to 13).


Is there some way for an app to link directly to the page shown in 12.jpg?


Separately, if there's any other advice for how to help a customer avoid unexpected restarts due to system updates, please let us know. Thanks!

Subject: app and firmware download behavior for managed WearOS devices
Description__c:
Domo is deploying dedicated elderly care wearables in kiosk mode with Knox Manage.

To minimize battery drain during use, Domo is selectively enabling and disabling mobile network connectivity.

Through they are able to increase the time before recharge is needed to up to 3 days.

When the device is in certain conditions (e.g. when charging), mobile data is enabled.


How are following cases handled for WearOS devices?


A. Firmware upgrade

  1. Do firmware upgrades of managed WearOS devices over mobile network mandate user interaction?
  2. Do partial firmware downloads resume from their last state when connectivity is restored, or is the download cancelled and restarting from scratch?

B. Application updates

  1. Do partial app updates that get applied via Knox Manage resume from their partial downloaded state in case connectivity is restored?


It would be important to understand the behavior to provision the correct mobile data plans, and to plan operational tasks after devices have been rolled out.

Subject: ATT System Updates Galaxy S24
Description__c:
Customer is in the process of evaluating the Samsung Galaxy S24 (SM-S921U) before their next replacement bulk order. They noticed to update their device, there is no option to download the updates automatically over cellular networks. This is an issue with the customer as not all turn on or have access to Wi-Fi leaving devices vulnerable.

 

Previously, In order to get the update on AT&T devices, ATT has set some pre-conditions

• Needs to have an Active SIM

• For Smartphones/Tablets (any update over 30 MB needs to be connected to WIFI and less than 30 MB can be updated over cellular data), so let’s assume, customer device is not connected to the WIFI, when the ATT FOTA server is trying a push, it will try at 3 different times. On the 4th time, it will skip the device and move to the next IMEI.

 

Recently, ATT has shifted control over FOTA servers to Samsung. How can Samsung create an exception for this customer to allow updates to download over cellular data for ATT?

Subject: Device seems to search for firmware updates even though FOTA is disabled
Description__c:
Hello!


We have an application where we can disable firmware updates over the air using RestrictionPolicy.allowOTAUpgrade(). When the application disables firmware updates, all menus under "software update" in settings get disabled, as expected. However, the switch preference "Download updates automatically" keeps the state it had before firmware updates were disabled as discussed in ticket TM1750HY. That is, if it was enabled before it is still in enabled state even though the menu is disabled and one might think the device will check for updates automatically.


The response from R&D last time was that this was the desired behavior since the value set by the user should be maintained and that the FOTA client blocks the FOTA operation, i.e. the device does not look for software updates automatically. (Note that we still consider this as undesired behavior since it causes confusion for the user. The device should still be able to keep/remember the user setting but only show the current setting which is "disabled".)


However, we have noticed that it seems like the FOTA client does not block checking for software updates automatically and nags to the user that there are software updates available. The dialog box that pops up states

"Software update

Software updates are controlled by your organization Contact the IT-administrator to get more information.".

Note, it is not possible to install any software.


This is how we have investigated the issue.

1) We started to see the dialog box about software updates described above almost once a day for the device

2) We enabled firmware updates and saw there was actually a security patch available for download

3) We downloaded the software update, but did not install it

4) We disabled firmware updates and pressed install on the downloaded software update

5) We were not allowed to install the update (as expected) and the downloaded software was probably removed (we could not press install or anything again)

6) After almost a day, we started to get notifications of software updates again even though FOTA was disabled by our application


We have also tested this for S10E model where we do not get any nagging of software updates when FOTA is disabled, even though the switch preference to download automatically over WiFi is enabled.


We want all FOTA functionality to be disabled when we disallow software updates, including checking for updates. Can you confirm that this issue only causes the user to experience nagging popups? Or is there any more FOTA functionality still operational when disallowing software updates?


Furthermore, is there any workaround for the issue on the A3 2017 device? Which other device models can we expect to have the same issue?


Kind Regards

Fredrik Waern

Subject: App crashes on Android 10 Samsung prerelease firmware
Description__c:
We are reaching out to you to take some help and guidance regarding the crash we are seeing with Android 10 Samsung prerelease firmware Samsung APK.

 

  • We are facing the below crash on most of our apps when the apps are trying to access the Samsung keyboard.

 

11-14 17:09:39.095 10889 10889 E AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main

11-14 17:09:39.095 10889 10889 E AndroidRuntime: Process: forgepond.com.mobileiron.android.pim:core, PID: 10889

11-14 17:09:39.095 10889 10889 E AndroidRuntime: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: No virtual method isFilterRequired()Z in class Lcom/samsung/android/content/clipboard/SemClipboardManager; or its super classes (declaration of 'com.samsung.android.content.clipboard.SemClipboardManager' appears in /system/framework/framework.jar!classes4.dex)


Our application uses SemClipboardManager on Samsung devices and adds some extra functionality to it. We do this in such way: call public methods from SemClipboardManager to obtain some data, process this data and pass it back to the SemClipboardManager. We also do the same on all other Android devices by accessing standard Android class: ClipboardManager. 

 

As of Android 10, Google has blacklisted SemClipboardManager public methods as part of their "Restrictions on non-SDK interfaces" policy:

  https://developer.android.com/distribute/best-practices/develop/restrictions-non-sdk-interfaces

This is what we see in logs:

Accessing hidden method Lcom/samsung/android/content/clipboard/SemClipboardManager;->isFiltered()Z (blacklist, linking, denied)



We would like to request to implement SemClipboardManager as extension of standard Android ClipboardManager, so that we could access it in standard Google-recommended way.

Subject: [ETS] Samsung Knox E-FOTA issue with adding devices to running campaign + firmware issues

We are having an issue with E-FOTA that when we create a campaign and we add 'allow devices to be added while the campaign is running' this option doesn't function, when new devices come online in the system they are not automaticly added to the running campaign, they are however added to the device group that is selected in the campaign.


For example we had a campaign running on 2100 devices at the start of the campaign, while we had 4000 active devices later on but the campaign was still on 2100.


We made a new campaign now but no devices will be added.


Second point we are facing is that we cannot update the firmware on the devices we constantly get an error when trying to update devices to a higher firmware version.


Made a testing campaign installing a software version on a device group. This doesn't work, gives following error: "Missing update file that corresponds to the reported device's tool version (-7032)".


Made a second campaign to install the latest patch and this gives following error: "Missing rollback update file that corresponds to the reported device's tool version (-7033)".


We would like to see a fix for these issues as currently nothing in E-FOTA works except the 'factory reset' option, further than that it has no use.


Kind regards,

Subject: Tizen 2.4 level of firmware also for SBB-SSF
Description__c:
Visual Art has many Tizen 2.4 units in the field as you know.

Currently they are working much on the Signage Player 3 that is cloud based and use other certificates than their local servers.

 

A year ago we solved a major issue for them where the app could not be installed or uninstalled on Tizen 2.4 devices, seemed to be Node-related? Ticket 00245206 solved with test FW T-HKMLAKUC 2150.19. Then also fixed for Outdoor later on, FW T-HKMLODWWC.

 

Now there are two issues with the old Tizen-box SBB-SSF. It seems it does not have all the root certificates that the other Tizen 2.4 have?

Visual Art are using "Organisation(O) Let's Encrypt" and ISRG Root X1.

 

And the application install fix was never applied to these devices either. Should be same branch somehow?

 

Could there be an update so that it has the same certificates and fixes as other Tizen 2.4 devices?

Currently SBB-SSF has TB-HMSCFDWWC-2090.2.

 

BR Fredrik

Subject: Firmware Bugs CF800 + BU800
Description__c:
During testing the latest available firmwares, (Bridge + latest prod), we came across an old issue I remember from the AU800 series (if I am correct):

- Setting the Virtual Standby to 5 Minutes within the Factory Menu (as default for RCCL on ALL TVs) does NOT reboot the mainboards of the TVs when powered off.

 

I have tested this with following firmwares, assuming all other versions in between show the same behaviour:

 

CF800: 1500.5 / 1501.0

BU800: 1640.9 / 1641.1 /1651.8/1680.1

 

This is a showstopper for us, as TVs are not refreshing themselves in normal operation like it was all years long with the pre Tizen 6.5 versions. If that feature is depricated, i would expect it being removed from factory menu. Given it’s there and can be set, I expect it to work.

 

So, this bug is taking away our last option to push a bridge firmware to the TVs without waiting for TVs to powercycle with human interaction. (As we can send commands to the frontend, which control the tv and powers off/on the tv like the remote handset would do)

 

Please let me know, when we can expect a fix for the “reboot when going to virt. Standby” feature, and in which firmware versions this will be merged. We don’t want to update TVs multiple times.

Subject: E-FOTA firmware sync email notifications
Description__c:
My issue is with the EFOTA product.


While working in EFOTA on the 3/6/2020, I added an A50 to a campaign. In the “Assign devices and Firmware” section the A50 was set to “Lock current firmware”.

When I changed the setting to “Select from Firmware List” there was no firmware present and had to wait for the firmware list sync to complete so I let that run while I attended to another task. Upon returning 5 mins later my inbox was bombarded with KNOX E-FOTA emails to advise me the firmware sync completed. I received just under 20 emails to advise me of this (see attached zip file of all the email notifications). My work colleagues who are admins in KNOX E-FOTA also received these spam emails. Those emails stopped once I selected a firmware version for that A50 device.


Would like to know why there is a need to constantly notify all admins that the firmware sync completed and is there a need to constantly send 2-3 emails every minute to advise that the sync has completed? I think one email notification would suffice.


The Knox E-FOTA One Admin Guide does state that when the firmware sync is completed you will receive an email notification however in my case it is more like you will keep receiving email notifications until the firmware version is selected.


Would like to know if only 1 email can be sent to advise the firmware sync has completed. Will this also occur when a new firmware version is available?

Subject: Black screen after firmware update
Description__c:
We have been testing using E-FOTA for firmware updates on SM-T220 A7 Lite tablets with our MDM. In one case we were updating to firmware T220XXU1AVE1/T220OXM1AVE1 the device rebooted and instead of the MDM home screen, firstly there was a message about the app being in full screen mode which then disappeared and then there was a black screen followed by a message saying that the System UI isn't responding.


The device then remained stuck with a black screen until it was rebooted, when it continued to install further firmware updates with no issues.


Are there any known issues with Android 11 firmware updates that could cause this kind of behaviour?

Subject: [ETS] How to check the firmware at first boot?
Description__c:
Hi Guys,


Some of our devices are migrated, enrolled and are having Android 14.

Android 14 is not working for some persons within some corporate apps.

We have seen that some of the devices are enrolled and having Android 14, we think that those devices are delivered with Android 14 because we are blocking the update trough Intune and via the EFOTA campaign.

We want to check before we are enrolling the device via KME in Intune which Android Android version the device is having.

I have tried a whole list of MMI codes but none of these are showing the Android version.


I hope you guys now which code or another way to check the Android version before enrolling into MDM.


Regards,


Revesh

Subject: I can't get some of my tablets to lock the firmware with Knox EFOTA
Description__c:
I currently use the Knox KME and Knox EFOTA service to lock my tablet's firmware.

My Samsung T220 Android 13 tablet running firmware T220XXS6CWL2.


When I enroll my tablet using my SOTI MobiControl EMM software, I am no longer seeing the white Knox terms and condition screen where I need to click "Agree".


In an effort to rule out my EMM SOTI software, I have even tried setting up a tablet (without using SOTI MobiControl software) and still can't get Knox EFOTA to lockdown firmware on my tablets,


How can we get this issue resolved?


Also, I have tried visiting (me.samsungknox.com). In the past, visiting this site on tablets has forced Knox EFOTA to install on the tablet which has locked down firmware in the past but this is no longer the case.


I have a Knox EFOTA campaign assed to the tablets that should be locking down firmware called the "Android 10" Campaign.


This issue has effected tablets #R83W602SN4E and tablet# R83W602SQVR.

"serious software issue detected"

Subject: Android System Updates
Description__c:
Dear Customer Support,


Sometimes we enroll a lot of devices at the same time. Thus we want them to automatically do all the necessary system updates.

Now we created a profile ("global_setup") in which we tried different system update settings. We tried "windowed" with a window from (4:00-3:59, so basically all day) and we tried "automatic" which should be triggered as soon as there is an update available.

We've witnessed the following:

  • Both settings led to system updates on some but not all devices. Around 50 percent of 30-40 devices.
  • No matter whether automatic or windowed, the updates we're not reliably triggered. Even after pushing the profile again to the device

Why is that? How can we overcome that?


Best regards,


Daniel

Subject: [ETS] EFOTA does not prevent user from updating firmware
Description__c:
Hi Team,

I have a really strange one. No matter what device this user enrols on, efota doesn't prevent the user from updating firmware.


It will continually check with server for update direct and offer to download and update.

I have attached dumpstate log of the phone at the state where it is offering the update to go to android 10 but have not click to download it.


Hope you can assist in deciphering this.

So far others doing the same process is not showing this problem.

Subject: Latest firmware update breaks Company portal work profile apps
Description__c:
Updated SM-T825Y tablet to the latest firmware update T825YDXU3CTD2. Once installed, company portal work profile apps such as Word, Excel, Outlook, Onedrive, Microsoft stream, Office lens, onenote, Powerpoint, Skype for business, Yammer, Acrobat Reader and Google Maps do not work.

Other work profile apps such as Google Chrome, Google Photos, My Telstra are the only ones that work.


Uninstalling and reinstalling these apps does not work. These apps get stuck in a downloading state without actually downloading. Work Google Play Store closes unexpectedly without warning especially when a work profile is downloading (even though it doesn't download).


Company Portal app version tested 5.0.4779.0 and the latest version 5.0.4814.0 do not improve this.


Work colleagues that haven't updated to the latest firmware on their tablets the company portal work apps are OK.

Subject: [VE-533]KME enrolment errors on A52s devices with A528BXXU1BUL7 firmware using Mobile Networks
Description__c:
Hi Team,


Our client BBVA has reported errors in the enrollment of the A52s device, using only the mobile network, with the latest version of the published firmware A528BXXU1BUL7. (attach screenshot).

These errors have not been reproduced using the Wi-Fi network, after 27 enrollment tests.

Integration of bypass solution implemented in Android 11 release (A528BXXU1AUK4) may be required.

Enrollment errors, assigned device in KME.

Error applying to E-FOTA ONE enrollment:

As of minute 05:21, (video and logs on links below) you can see how the device returns to the Wi-Fi configuration again, after entering the credentials in MobileIron Go.

After the Wi-Fi step is skipped, the device receives the E-Fota One profile, installs it, and after this installation the device displays the desktop.

MobileIron Go prompt "2 items require your attention" is displayed in the notification area, location options and lock PIN are set, but corporate email account settings are not displayed, device needs to be restarted to account settings appear in the notification area.

This problem occurs in 100% of enrollments using the mobile network.

Logs https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-4AWq_y4YissNPPtolj-RTtSt_6Di2Gn/view?usp=sharing

Vídeo https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=539ysJbbDhw

Additionally, the client has performed tests using Zero touch and a mobile network connection with similar results.(video and logs link below)

Error applying in the E-FOTA ONE enrollment:

At minute 04:30 it is observed how the device returns to the Wi-Fi configuration menu after entering the credentials in MobileIron Go.

In this case, E-Fota One does not appear after skipping Wi-Fi setup, the device is setup successfully.

Logs https://drive.google.com/file/d/1--6BiDvNBpLqlG4mo0sgWtfTx9Zvez0a/view?usp=sharing

Vídeo https://youtu.be/qMXJY0oOmuo

Unapplied error in E-FOTA ONE enrollment:

At minute 06:53, it can be seen how the device returns to the Wi-Fi configuration menu after entering the credentials in MobileIron Go.

Afterwards, the device is configured correctly, until the configuration of the corporate email arrives at minute 09:40 where it is hooked, having to configure it up to two times to make it operational.

Logs https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-00A9e6Amqn5I79ZWhKnmWeYdNQbkeg4/view?usp=sharing

Vídeo https://youtu.be/av7cbnsN1F4

BBVA has opened a case with Samsung on this issue under Case# 00232463.


Thanks,Shen

Subject: E-FOTA firmware release delay and alerts
Description__c:
We are seeing a long delay in the release of Android security updates for our devices e.g. the 1st February security patch for the Samsung A12 was only released on the 17th March.

 

Is there any way that we can subscribe to be alerted when updates are released for our various devices please?

 

This would be very useful and particularly at the moment for our E-FOTA pilot as we are trying to monitor the timings of update deployments versus devices that do not have E-FOTA installed.

Subject: Wifi issue on A23 5G after firmware update
Description__c:
The customer reports that since the latest firmware update of the SM-A236B (A23 5G) devices with security patch October 2022 the Wifi has stopped working properly. Before the update the Wifi worked right.

 

When the Wifi is activated on the device it is not able to connect to the corporate network although the device yes has visibility and associates with the AP.

After an initial analysis by the customer, the issue seems to be related with the EAP – PEAP management of this device. Seems not to be properly started as they couldn’t see any traffic between the implicated APs and the reception or exchanges of the certificates required to establish the connection.

 

They found the following error in Logs:

 

11-17 10:29:36.556 1000 564 564 I hwservicemanager: getTransport: Cannot find entry android.hardware.wifi.supplicant@1.4::ISupplicant/default in either framework or device VINTF manifest.

 

The device works fine with other Wifi networks (WPA2-Personal) but with the (WPA2-Enterprise) it doesn’t.

 

The current Wifi config of the devices is as follows:

 

SSID: eduroam

EAP method: PEAP

Authentication: MSCHAPv2

CA certificate: AC-UGR (Previously installed)

Identity: email address ( xxxxx@ugr.es / xxxx@correo.ugr.es )

Anonymous Identity: anonymous@ugr.es

Password: (user password)

 

In addition, on Samsung A13 with an earlier version (from September) the Wifi is working as expected.

 

The customer attached Dumpstate logs from the issue reproduction.

 

Could you please check to find out the root cause of the issue?

 

Thanks,

Best regards,

Subject: [ETS] Managing of Google Play System Updates
Description__c:
Hi Samsung Team,


I am sorry to disturb you again on this subject.


our VMWARE EMM Support wrote to me when I asked him if our EMM VMWARE Workspace One had a way to manage the Google Play System updates:


Hi Marcel,

Confirmation on this from the internal team.

There is no option to manage updates for Google Play Services Updates as the APIs are not available from Google.

There was a Feature Request raised with Google some time ago (Google ticket# 135986742), however, Google stated that the relevant APIs were deprecated.

If you have an option to reach out directly to Google that is be the only option available at the moment.

Sorry we can't provide anything further on this.


My question to you as famous world best Smartphone Manufacturer is:


Do you not have a change at Google to push the issue Google ticket# 135986742 further with an API for the Google Play System updates?


br Marcel

Phil

Subject: [ETS] E-FOTA Syncing Firmware
Description__c:
Hi,


Quick question. We noticed that sometimes when we are trying to attach Firmware to a campaign we see a screen that states Firmware syncing. We have also notices with a test device, that was attached to a campaign that was syncing firmware, we were unable to get E-FOTA to work after a new registration. E-FOTA would try to enable for a long time but did not work.


It is kind of an edge case and it is hard to reproduce etc. We just like to receive some information:


  • When does this syncing occurs, is it periodic?
  • Are you unable to register a device with E-FOTA when you have a Campaign attached to the device that is currently syncing?
  • How about Firmware updates on the device, will this work when the campaign is Syncing?


Again no major issues or something, we just want to enhance our understanding of the E-FOTA process and maybe anticipate some potential issues.


Regards,


Sebastiaan

Subject: [ETS] The customer requires documented proof that Knox Attestation can still detect unauthorized firmware modifications, as this control is a safety-critical component for their medical device regulatory compliance.
Description__c: The customer confirmed that their previous test case is likely invalid because Samsung now signs temporary firmware updates under Enhanced Attestation V3. Rooting a Galaxy Tab Active 5 to simulate unauthorized firmware detection would be destructive and complicated by MDM restrictions. Given the regulatory requirements, they need proof of Knox’s detection capabilities, preferably through official documentation or validation from Samsung’s R&D team. We have escalated the case internally to request such documentation to avoid destructive testing.

It has now been observed that it is not possible to update to Android 12 from these Firmware Binaries, when they are installed on a device, either by E-FOTA ONE or by regular FOTA:

  • regular FOTA will simply not offer an update to Android 12 when any of these firmwares are used

We have about 3-4 A71 that with the same error. We do have about 190 A71's, so there are just a few of them that fails.


There is about 100 GB free space, plugged in cable (over 50 % battery) and we got a good Wifi Connection.


Do you have any suggestions?

Subject: [WM65R] Fragen betreff Firmware Update via Internet
Description__c:
GENERAL/REQUEST INFORMATION:

- *Problem Description:

Hallo Samuel,

dieser Kunde möchte die URL der Downloadseite für aut. Firmware Updates zum FLIP, er ist der Meinung die Geräte beziehen die Firmware direkt aus dem Netz. Bitte hierzu die Kundemeldung unten prüfen.

Wir hatten ihm bereits mitgeteilt, dass die Geräte nicht direkt nach der aktuellen Firmware suchen und haben Ihm die aktuelle Firmware zugestellt.

Trotzdem meldet er sich erneut betreff URL zur Downloadseite.

 

Unsere Meldung an den Kunden:

"Gerne unterstützen wir Sie bei Ihrer Anfrage bezüglich Firmware.

Die Geräte beziehen die Firmware nicht direkt aus dem Netz, die Firmware muss manuell heruntergaleden werden.

Der Zugriff auf die Downloads benötigt ein Passwort unter displaysolutions.samsung.com.

Bitte konatktieren Sie Ihren Key Account Manager um Zugriff zu erhalten.

Gerne können Sie uns anschreiben um eine Firmware anzufragen.

 

Untenstehend der Link zur USB Version:

 

File Name : T-MSMEBWWC-1210.3_USB.zip

File Size : 1.1GB"

 

- Customer Request:

Herzlichen Dank für Ihre rasche Rückmeldung und die USB-Version der Firmware.

 

Gewissermaßen ist es doch dennoch automatisch, da wir auf den Flips Update anwählen können und diese dann automatisch ausgeführt werden. Unser Problem ist, dass wir einen restriktiven Internetzugang den Flips gewähren (aus Datenschutzgründen). Daher wäre es gut, wenn wir die URL der Download Seite hätten, damit wir diese frei geben können.

Könnten Sie uns da eventuell weiterhelfen?

 

Besten Dank im Voraus für Ihre Bemühungen.

 

Freundliche Grüsse

Ö. Bilecan

Subject: Automatic Update policy not working
Description__c:
Hi Team,


We are Scalefusion which is an Android Enterprise solution. Our agent which is the DPC used the the following API to set update policy

https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/admin/DevicePolicyManager#setSystemUpdatePolicy(android.content.ComponentName,%20android.app.admin.SystemUpdatePolicy)


We have set the update policy to automatic and we see that the device has an update available. However the update does not happen automatically.

We have verified that in bug report the policy is correctly applied and also it shows the pending update.

We would like to know why the update is not happening?


Please note this has been reported by multiple customers on different devices and hence we are raising the severity.

Subject: Some devices fails to upgrade automatically after set system update policy to automatic
Description__c:
Hello

Customer reports that after apply the system upgrade profile by Android Intelligent Hub, some Samsung devices could not upgrade automatically. When attempted to check and install updates we are able to find the updates pending and customer can update manually .


While this issue only happens on some of the devices but not on other set of devices.

Here are some examples:

Not replicated on Galaxy S21 on Android 12

Replicated on Galaxy S22 on Android 14, S20 on Android 12


As the device policy controller, Android Intelligent Hub invoke following API to set the upgrade policy:

android.app.admin.DevicePolicyManager.setSystemUpdatePolicy(ComponentName admin, SystemUpdatePolicy policy)


The policy argument here is created by API

android.app.admin.SystemUpdatePolicy.createAutomaticInstallPolicy()


The bug report on Galaxy S22 is attached.


Please help to look into this issue and keep us posted.


Thanks

Subject: Automatic System Update
Description__c:
Hallo sehr geehrter Kundenservice,


Problembeschreibung: In Knox Manage gibt es die Möglichkeit das System Update Verhalten auszuwählen. Folgende Optionen sind gegeben:

  1. Automatic
  2. Postponed
  3. Windowed

Wir bekommen neue Geräte ins Haus, nehmen diese in Knox auf und melden den Knox User an. Gruppen, Profile und Apps werden auf die Geräte gespielt und alles funktioniert.

Wir haben bereits ein Profil (global_setup) das ausschließlich das System Update Verhalten regeln soll.


Ziel: Gerät soll direkt alle verfügbaren Systemupdates laden und installieren.


Bereits versucht:

  1. Automatic: Bei manchen Geräten wird das System Update ausgeführt und bei anderen nicht. Alle Geräte haben exakt die selben Gruppen und Profile zugewiesen. Es ist nicht ersichtlich was der tatsächliche "Trigger"/"Auslöser" ist, welcher den System Update Prozess startet.
  2. Windowed: 4:00-3:59, soll größt mögliches Fenster sein, um unverzüglich alle System Updates zu laden und installieren. Zeigt selbes Verhalten wie bei Automatisch.


Betroffene Gruppe/Profil:

Gruppe: global.Setup

Profil: global_setup


Betroffenes Gerät (Device IMEI):

Beispiel: 356904752022924 (update wurde mittlerweile händisch ausgeführt)


Frage: Was oder wie genau wird der System Update Prozess gestartet intern? Was ist der Trigger? Welche Bedingungen müssen alle erfüllt sein, dass man sich darauf verlassen kann, dass das System Update auch tatsächlich ausgeführt wird.


Zusätzliche Infos:

Wir hatten beobachtet das manche Geräte über Nacht dann irgendwann den Prozess starten und sich updaten, jedoch nicht zuverlässig. Wichtig wäre also wirklich zu wissen, was der konkrete (knox interne) Auslöser für den Update Prozess ist.


Tenant ID: netwake.com


Mit freundlichen Grüßen,


Netwake

Subject: [ETS] 00049746-Knox E-FOTA One-Error 364-Assigned firmware version invalid-A135U1UEU2AVK8
Description__c:
Customer Details:

• Medtronic

• Ben Keller

• ben.keller@medtronic.com

 

Problem Statement:

Customer reports receiving Error code 364.

 

Summary:

This error occurs when there is no valid installation path for the target firmware version.

 

Environment:

Knox E-FOTA One

Customer ID: 9663325987

Model:

SM-A135U1

Installed Firmware:

A135U1UEU2AVK8

 

Example Device: 350127630007596

 

Campaign Name: N1306 Diabetes Minerva Clinician and Patient

 

Expected Behavior:

Device begins controlled updated via E-FOTA.

 

Actual Behavior:

E-FOTA returns Error code 364 "Assigned firmware version invalid"

 

Reproduction Steps:

1. Assign Campaign to the device.

2. Assign latest version available.

 

Reproduction Rate:

100%

 

Number of devices Impacted:

customer pending

 

Work Completed:

Collected E-FOTA agent logs (see EFOTA_Device_Log_List.csv).

Confirmed client status ()

 

Logs | Videos | Screenshots:

EFOTA_Device_Log_List.csv

Screenshot 2024-07-09 at 1.03.14 PM.png

 

Working Theory:

We normally only host 1 year of firmware updates on the E-FOTA server but in the case of (Device ID: 350127630007596), it falls outside that window.

 

The installed firmware version is A135U1UEU2AVK8 (Release Date : 2022-12-12) but the target firmware version is A135U1UES7DXE2 (Release Date : 2024-05-24), so there are intermediate builds that are no longer available on our server.

 

Escalation Request:

Please upload the intermediate firmware builds required to complete this update.

 

Next Step:

Pending R&D upload of intermediate firmware builds.

Subject: Platinum partner ticket: BlackBerry/Secusmart – German Government Classified use - August Level Firmwares show ONEUI crash if packet is blocked
Description__c:
German Govt User cases have required blocking the package com.samsung.android.mcfds for several years. Both SecuSUITE for Samsung Knox as well as Knox Native require blocking this package.


On the latest S23 and S24 family firmware updates (the second Firmwres with Android Patchlevel August 24) deployed, if this package is disabled (eg via KSP), ONEUI will crash on device reboot and periodically after.


For reference: the FIRST August MR Build numbers WITHOUT this problem are:

S23-family: S911BXXS6CXGA / S911BXXS6CXGA / S911BXXS6CXGA

S24-Family: S921BXXS3AXGF / S928BXXS3AXGF


The SECOND August MR Build numbers WITH this issue are:

S23-family: S911BXXU6CXH7 / S916BXXU6CXH7 / S918BXXU6CXH7

S24-family: S921BXXU3AXH7 /S928BXXU3AXH7


See attached log for example of this behaviour.

Subject: Issue with Reach Channel List Setup After Firmware Update
Description__c:
Hello Team,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

I’d like to escalate an ongoing issue with one of our partners regarding their HTVs and the Reach channel list setup. Below are the detailed observations and steps taken:

 

Title of the issue:

Issue with Reach Channel List Setup After Firmware Update

 

Description of the issue:

Our partner has been experiencing an ongoing issue with 63 HTVs (model HG65EJ690U) installed in a motel. After a firmware update in May 2024, necessitated by previous problems with Samsung Reach, the 'Cable' option disappeared from the channel tuning menu. As a result, it is no longer possible to sort the TV channels. Despite multiple attempts following provided troubleshooting steps, the issue persists. The Reach version currently installed is up-to-date (4.1 1601).

 

What troubleshoots we have tried:

 

Verified the Room Number and Group ID settings in the REACH Solution menu.

Confirmed firmware update to version 1400.

Attempted channel setup verification and auto-tuning with 'Cable' as the aerial type.

Reinstalled the provided firmware version shared by the support team.

Reviewed the sorting options in the 'Edit Channel List' menu, confirming they are missing.

Checked and confirmed the TV configuration via screenshots provided by the customer.

Ensured the customer has the most recent Reach version (4.1 1601) installed and operational.

Asked the customer to ensure the settings persist across all devices after performing recommended steps.

What is the Expected result:

The customer should be able to sort channels and have the 'Cable' option available in the menu.

 

What is the Actual Result:

The 'Cable' option remains unavailable, and channel sorting is not possible. The issue persists after all troubleshooting steps.

 

Files attached to the case:

 

Screenshots of the TV system and menu options.

Completed field checklist with all relevant details.

Thank you in advance for reviewing this case. Please let me know if further details are required or additional steps need to be taken.

 

Looking forward to your guidance on resolving this issue.

 

Best regards,

Biser Raikov

Samsung Electronics B2B Support Hub Team

Subject: [ETS] 00053568 | Samsung OneUI Issue after firmware upgrade
Description__c:
Request Statement:

 

User is locked out of the device after A13 device upgrades firmware, the OneUI update takes hold and Omnissa launcher cannot regain control.

 

Questions:

Once user completes the setup wizard i.e., Welcome to One UI 6.1 will OneUI clears itself as default home application?

If the answer to the above question is Yes, then is there any broadcast to know when the One UI setup is completed? Workspace One Launcher can try to set itself as default home app after the user completes this.

Please reference case 00314850 that was opened by Omnissa.

 

Request Summary: Customer comments

 

We are having issues with Omnissa's WorkspaceOne launcher and have had a ticket open with them for a while and they have said that they have a ticket open with Samsung as well.

Omnissa's ticket number is 00314850 opened with Samsung.

Our Omnissa case is 01006950.

Once the A13 device upgrades to Firmware the OneUI update takes hold and then Omnissa's launcher cannot regain control and the user is locked out of the device and so far, our only fix is to remove and reinstall launcher which then the initial prompts take control again or a device wipe and re-enroll.

 

Number of Impacted Devices/Users:

 

TBD

 

Customer Temperature:

 

GREEN

 

Reproduction Rate:

 

TBD

 

Reproduction Steps:

 

The customer has enrolled their Samsung XCover device running on OneUI 6.0 using Workspace One solution

They have lockdown the device in kiosk mode using Workspace One Launcher solution

They recently upgraded their devices, resulting in OneUI upgrade from 6.0 to 6.1

OneUI sets itself as the default home app by showing Welcome to One UI 6.1 after the device boots up with Explore button at the bottom. (Refer to attached video -- Upgrade to OS14.mp4)

However, Workspace One Launcher tries to come to the foreground asking the user to set Workspace One Launcher as the Default Home app.

This causes the device to be stuck in a loop situation

To handle this use case from Workspace One Launcher side we have below two queries

 

Expected Behavior:

 

Setup Wizard should see that kiosk mode is set and automatically skip setup.

Default apps should not be affected.

 

Actual Behavior:

 

Omnissa Launcher is being suppressed by the setup wizard one the first boot with OneUI 6.1.

 

Environment:

 

MDM = Omnissa

Kiosk = Omnissa Launcher

Device = Samsung A13

 

Logs/Videos/Screenshots:

 

See logs and video attached to case 00314850

 

Logging Timestamps:

 

NA

 

Log Snips:

 

NA

 

Workaround:

 

1. Remove and reinstall launcher which then the initial prompts take control again

2. Device wipe and re-enroll.

3. FOTA updates have been halted for now.

 

Working Theory:

 

From 00314850 L3 notes:

Kiosk mode starts before the FOTA Setup Wizard finishes properly and thus the default home app information is not obtained.

Subject: Samsung Interactive Display WM65B – PDF Download Issue After Firmware Upgrade
Description__c:
Dear team,

 

Trust this message finds you well. I'd like to bring a case with one of our partners to your attention.

 

Title of the issue:

WM65B – PDF files cannot be downloaded from specific website after firmware upgrade

 

Description of the issue:

Our partner Lasercharge has reported an issue with a Samsung Interactive Display WM65B installed at Olympion School. The device was recently serviced due to a motherboard failure. After the replacement, the unit was updated from firmware version 1100.6 to 1110.6 (and later also tested with 1120.3). Since the firmware update, the device cannot download PDF files from the following educational website:

 

https://mathd.schools.ac.cy/index.php/el/yliko/didaktiko-yliko-a-taxi

 

Other WM65B units at the school running firmware 1100.6 do not exhibit this problem and are able to download the same PDFs without issue. This strongly suggests the issue is firmware-related.

 

The device is using the default Samsung Internet browser, and the issue is reproducible only on this specific website. Downloads from other websites (e.g., generic PDF links from unrelated sources) work without any problem. There are no proxy/firewall or filtering rules in place that would selectively block this site, and the behavior has been confirmed in a lab environment by both the partner and our internal team.

 

What troubleshoots we have tried:

 

Confirmed the issue is isolated to a single WM65B device upgraded to firmware 1110.6 and 1120.3.

Verified that the issue does not occur on other WM65B devices running firmware 1100.6.

Partner provided a video showing successful PDF download on 1100.6 from the same website.

Used the default Samsung Internet app on all tests.

Verified that the screen can successfully download PDFs from other websites, ruling out a general connectivity or browser issue.

Partner completed the Field Checklist, which is attached.

Issue has been reproduced internally using WM65B on 1110.6 firmware.

Expected result:

Subject: [ETS] Upgrade firmware
Description__c:
Hello,

I created an update campaign for device SM-X706B 354848360401446 (Knox Admin Portal).

Its initial OS version was X706BXXU2AVH2/X706BXXU2AVH2/X706BOXM2AVH2.

The campaign targeted version X706BXXS9CYB1/X706BXXS9CYB1/X706BOXM9CYB1 (the latest version of Android 14).

It turns out that the update isn't a one-time process, but requires multiple steps, which seems understandable to me.

The "automatic" upgrade steps are as follows:

  • Android 12 to the first version of Android 13
  • First version of Android 13 to the latest version of Android 13
  • Latest version of Android 13 to the first version of Android 14
  • First version of Android 14 to the latest version of Android 14

However, it turns out that the terminal stopped at version X706BXXS5BWI1/X706BXXS5BWI1/X706BOXM5BWH6.

Looking at the campaign, it seems to be related to a model, reseller code, or CSC version issue (see screenshot).

Could you analyze the issue and give me feedback, please, as this is a limiting factor if we have to generalize this campaign.


Best regards

David D

Subject: Subject: Issue with Automatic System Updates on Samsung Device (SM-X218U)
Description__c:
Hi Team,


Scalefusion is an EMM partner and has observed an issue specific to Samsung devices.


We are configuring system updates to install automatically using the DevicePolicyManager API method setSystemUpdatePolicy(), with the policy set to SystemUpdatePolicy.TYPE_INSTALL_AUTOMATIC. The device has pending system updates, and upon applying the automatic update policy, the update is expected to install automatically when the system update is available to update. However, the update is not being triggered as expected. We have gone through the Bugreport for the logs IDM_FOTA, but couldn't find any helpful information on the issue. 


Device Details:

Make: Samsung

Model: SM-X218U

OS Version: Android 14


For reference, we have attached theBugreport and a screenshot of the device's About section.

As per the Bugreport, the policy appears to have been applied successfully:

System Update Policy: SystemUpdatePolicy (type: 1, windowStart: 0, windowEnd: 0, freezes: [])


Device Policy Manager API reference: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/admin/DevicePolicyManager#setSystemUpdatePolicy(android.content.ComponentName,%20android.app.admin.SystemUpdatePolicy)


We are awaiting your feedback on this issue.


Best regards,

Lalit Boratse

Subject: Samsung Devices Entering Android Recovery Screen Post System Update
Description__c:
The customer reported that a number of their Samsung devices are booting into the Android Recovery screen after receiving a System Update notification. Once the update is applied, devices fail to boot normally and require re-enrollment.

Upon investigation, it was identified that out of a total of 2985 Samsung devices, 1834 devices were assigned a profile named “White Cap – Knox configs for Drivewyze”, which was used to push OEMConfig settings. The profile had the “Firmware Upgrade OTA” setting enabled.

The customer was advised to disable this toggle and re-deploy the profile to all affected devices.

Upon follow-up, the customer confirmed that the issue still persists, even after the profile was updated and pushed.

The affected models include:

  • Samsung SM-G736U
  • Samsung SM-X218U
  • Samsung SM-S906U2

These devices have been confirmed to have a OS 15 update available from Samsung.

The issue leads to automatic firmware updates being installed, after which devices fail to boot and enter Android Recovery Mode. The only current workaround is to factory reset and re-enroll the affected devices — a time-consuming and disruptive process.

Impact description:

Business Impact/Criticality: This is disrupting production as impacted devices lose their ability to be used and require a factory reset and re-enrollment.

Number of Devices Already Enrolled: 2985

 

Actual Behaviour:

Samsung devices should complete the system update process and reboot normally, without entering Android Recovery Mode or requiring a factory reset.

Expected Behaviour:

Post update installation, Samsung devices fail to boot and enter Android Recovery Mode.

Devices require a factory wipe and re-enrollment to resume normal operation.

Samsung Galaxy S23

Samsung Galaxy XCover 6 Pro

 

In this case, Nima said that we will get a download link and then we can install the rooted firmware via Odin or some other flash tool.


Kind regards,

Sebastian Grieser

Subject: function b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware() does not work on Tizen6.5 or Tizen7.0 screens
Description__c:
Hello,


We noticed that


b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(SoftwareID, SWUFileName, SWVersion, SWURL, SWTotalBytes, onSuccess, onError);


works well with Tizen 2.4 and Tizen 4.0 but not wit 6.5 and 7.0


The command disable the "off" remote button for a while but does not do anything, after a reboot the screen works (thank God) but the FW has not been updated. It seems the onSuccess function is called (very quickly).


Here are our testing code with a Tizen 6.5 screen :


async updateFirmware(task_id) {

return new Promise(async function(resolve, reject) {

try {

var SoftwareID = "0";

var SWVersion = "S-PTMWWC 1120.7";

var SWURL = "http://mycast.ch/work/firmwares/QMB/1120/swuimage.bem";

var SWTotalBytes = 1503775830;

var SWUFileName = bem_file_url.substring(SWURL.lastIndexOf('/')+1);

var onSuccess = function(val) {

Debug.traceDebug("[updateFirmware] success : " + val, "info", "green");

CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 2, "update firmware start running --- 0% finished");

};

var onError = async function(error) {

Debug.traceDebug("[updateFirmware] code :" + error.code + " error name: " + error.name + " message " + error.message, "error");

await CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 4, "update firmware error");

reject("[updateFirmware] code :" + error.code + " error name: " + error.name + " message " + error.message, "error");

};

var onchange = async function(data) {

Debug.traceDebug("Updating firmware progress changed :" + data.data + "% finished", "info", "green");

await CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 2, "update firmware running --- " + data.data + "% finished");

if (data.data == 100) {

await CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 3, "update firmware running --- 100% finished");

resolve({code: 3, description: "firmware update done"});

}

};

b2bapis.b2bcontrol.setUpdateFirmwareProgressChangeListener(onchange);

b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(SoftwareID, SWUFileName, SWVersion, SWURL, SWTotalBytes, onSuccess, onError);

} catch (e) {

Debug.traceDebug("updateFirmware exception [" + e.code + "] name: " + e.name + " message: " + e.message, "error");

reject("updateFirmware exception [" + e.code + "] name: " + e.name + " message: " + e.message, "error");

}

});

}


and with a Tizen 7.0 screen:


async updateFirmware(task_id) {

return new Promise(async function(resolve, reject) {

try {

var SoftwareID = "0";

var SWVersion = "S-PTMLWWC 1060.9";

var SWURL = "http://mycast.ch/work/firmwares/QMC/1060.9/swuimage.bem";

var SWTotalBytes = 1407803199;

var SWUFileName = bem_file_url.substring(SWURL.lastIndexOf('/')+1);


var onSuccess = function(val) {

Debug.traceDebug("[updateFirmware] success : " + val, "info", "green");

CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 2, "update firmware start running --- 0% finished");

};

var onError = async function(error) {

Debug.traceDebug("[updateFirmware] code :" + error.code + " error name: " + error.name + " message " + error.message, "error");

await CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 4, "update firmware error");

reject("[updateFirmware] code :" + error.code + " error name: " + error.name + " message " + error.message, "error");

};

var onchange = async function(data) {

Debug.traceDebug("Updating firmware progress changed :" + data.data + "% finished", "info", "green");

await CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 2, "update firmware running --- " + data.data + "% finished");

if (data.data == 100) {

await CommonUtils.sendTaskState(urlUpdateTask, task_id, 3, "update firmware running --- 100% finished");

resolve({code: 3, description: "firmware update done"});

}

};

b2bapis.b2bcontrol.setUpdateFirmwareProgressChangeListener(onchange);

b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(SoftwareID, SWUFileName, SWVersion, SWURL, SWTotalBytes, onSuccess, onError);

} catch (e) {

Debug.traceDebug("updateFirmware exception [" + e.code + "] name: " + e.name + " message: " + e.message, "error");

reject("updateFirmware exception [" + e.code + "] name: " + e.name + " message: " + e.message, "error");

}

});

}


NB: we are still using "var" for compatibility reasons with older screens...


Thanks in advance for your help


Kind regards


Thomas

Subject: [FER][ETS] FER, E-FOTA Firmware installation period, forced install on end date.
Description__c:
Hi,

I'm creating this case by request of a colleague, Martijn van Dijk:


For Samsung Knox e-FOTA we would like to raise a FER.

Currently we have the option to select schedule based firmware updates, or during specific timeslots.

The thing we would like to see, is to set an end-date for the update to be installed.


This would work like this: date for installation is set to 30th of October including a timeslot 13:00.

A device will get this campaign, and will download the firmware update when connected to Wi-Fi or Cellular (based on a selectable option by admin) or both.

When the firmware is downloaded a message will appear on the device which states the end-date before installing the update.

If the user wants to, installation is allowed before the end date on a time selected by the user itself.


But when the end-date is reached, the 30th of October 12, 13:00, the device needs to have this update installed and without user interaction the device will install the update.


Before installing this multiple notifications have been given to the user and therefore the user would have had plenty time to install when it would fit best.

For example, multiple notifications will be send during the week just before forced installation and on the exact date, 4 hours before, 2 hours before and 1 hour before installation notifications will be send.


If we need to elaborate more details on this request, please let us know so that we can help to think all options through.


Thanks,


Best regards,

Fedde Blokland

Subject: Samsung device fails to update automaitcally after system update policy is set
Description__c:
Continuation request from the following case

Case No: 00303987 - Samsung device fails to update automaitcally after system update policy is set


The above case was closed. But we have few followup's.

As per the resolution of the above case, we were told that Airwatch has set the restriction to block firmware

allowFirmwareAutoUpdate: false


But, from Airwatch we never call the samsung API specified in the Previous Case.

https://docs.samsungknox.com/devref/knox-sdk/reference/com/samsung/android/knox/restriction/AdvancedRestrictionPolicy.html#allowFirmwareAutoUpdate(boolean)


We are not intending to call the above API, since not all our customers currently have the premium key entitled.


So, as per the original issue specified below, we would expect the following Android API to functional properly.

SystemUpdatePolicy policy = SystemUpdatePolicy.createAutomaticInstallPolicy();

DevicePolicyManager manger = getDevicePolicyManager();

manger.setSystemUpdatePolicy(componet, policy)


So, kindly assist with the analysis for the Original Customer issue as given below.


The original issue:

The customer reports that after deploy the system update profile which set the device update policy type as 1 (automatic), the system update does not happens on some devices. The system update can only be triggered when user manually start it.

We are using the system API to do this:

SystemUpdatePolicy policy = SystemUpdatePolicy.createAutomaticInstallPolicy();

DevicePolicyManager manger = getDevicePolicyManager();

manger.setSystemUpdatePolicy(componet, policy)

Subject: Samsung device fails to update automaitcally after system update policy is set
Description__c:
Continuation request from the following case

Case No: 00303987 - Samsung device fails to update automaitcally after system update policy is set


The above case was closed. But we have few followup's.

As per the resolution of the above case, we were told that Airwatch has set the restriction to block firmware

allowFirmwareAutoUpdate: false


But, from Airwatch we never call the samsung API specified in the Previous Case.

https://docs.samsungknox.com/devref/knox-sdk/reference/com/samsung/android/knox/restriction/AdvancedRestrictionPolicy.html#allowFirmwareAutoUpdate(boolean)


We are not intending to call the above API, since not all our customers currently have the premium key entitled.


So, as per the original issue specified below, we would expect the following Android API to functional properly.

SystemUpdatePolicy policy = SystemUpdatePolicy.createAutomaticInstallPolicy();

DevicePolicyManager manger = getDevicePolicyManager();

manger.setSystemUpdatePolicy(componet, policy)


So, kindly assist with the analysis for the Original Customer issue as given below.


The original issue:

The customer reports that after deploy the system update profile which set the device update policy type as 1 (automatic), the system update does not happens on some devices. The system update can only be triggered when user manually start it.

We are using the system API to do this:

SystemUpdatePolicy policy = SystemUpdatePolicy.createAutomaticInstallPolicy();

DevicePolicyManager manger = getDevicePolicyManager();

manger.setSystemUpdatePolicy(component, policy)

Subject: QM32C Firmware Downgrade from 1100.8 to 1070.7
Description__c:
There are 74 Units of QM32C displays installed on site, they all were on 1070.7 FW.

Custom VITEC app is running on the displays.

Displays are controlled (turned on and off, volume up and down) by 3rd party control system.

SI partner has reported an issue running the VITEC custom app that when the TV goes into standby it keeps playing the scream audio through the audio out jack and the TV doesn’t disconnect from the VITEC server. It only does this on version 1100 but none of the previous versions. Previous version that the rest of displays on is 1070.7.


SI has updated just one display to 1100.8 FW, then stopped when had an issue with Audio playing when displays is on standby.

SI has reached out to VITEC, VITEC has advised that nothing was changed on their server.


SI has asked to downgrade the FW from 1100.8 back to 1070.7.

Please provide a downgrade 1070.7 FW.


I have uploaded the video with the display on 1070.7 version where audio stops working when display is turned off as expected, and 1100.8 where audio is still playing when display is turned off.


Thank you.

Subject: HAU8000 - Firmware Rollback Request
Description__c:
To whome it May Concern,


I hope you're well.


We’re currently working with Vitec on a project involving the Samsung HAU8000 series displays, and we’ve encountered some issues with newer firmware versions impacting performance and compatibility with some IPTV channels.


To assist with troubleshooting and to help isolate the problem, Vitec has specifically requested access to firmware version 2120 for the HAU8000. We’d like to test this version, as it appears to be the last known stable release that worked reliably with their solution.


Could you please advise if it’s possible to obtain this earlier firmware version or facilitate a rollback process?


We understand firmware downgrades are not typically recommended, but this is a controlled testing scenario with technical support in place. We’ll ensure all risks are managed appropriately.


Looking forward to your guidance on this.


Regards,

Nick Sandford

Subject: Update Firmware API
Description__c:
I would like to integrate a device system firmware update feature in my application by utilizing the SystemControl API's

updateFirmware() method (or b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware() for devices with Tizen version<6.5)


Three inquiries for this:

  1. Is there a Samsung portal where I can download different .bem files from, so that I can later have them in a remote host link (provided as the sWURL property value for the updateFirmware() method) where the devices can download them from?
  2. Suppose a device has the latest available firmware version installed. Is a downgrade to a previous firmware version possible through calling the above methods? (So essentially, will calling updateFirmware() with an older firmware's parameters initiate a system firmware downgrade?
  3. Let's suppose a firmware update has been initiated through my application. Will this override every UI/user interaction with the device? What happens if the device is turned off/unplugged during this process and what is the expected event when the devices turns on again?



Thank you in advance.

Subject: webapis.systemcontrol.updateFirmware implementing
Description__c:
I got 2 files from you, an upgrade and a downgrade firmware.


Now I'm implementing the updateFirmware function, but when I call


b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(SoftwareID, SWUFileName, SWVersion, SWURL, SWTotalBytes, onSuccess, onError);


then It immediately calls the onSuccess function, and I got a successfully upgraded message. But I'm sure it cannot download the 1.4Gb from the local network so fast. And After some time the TV is restarting and after that if I check the firmware version it is changing. So I think it is doing the update in the background.


But If I got the success true immediately, how do I know that the firmware download is succeed, or any problem is occurs in the update process. And how do I know when it is finished, to display the progress/errors on the user interface?

Good morning,

 

CC - Meranno Principe <meranno.p@samsung.com>


This is a similar issue that happened before - previous case for reference – 00312353.

 

I’ve followed the instructions in that case, but it doesn’t seem to help. Basically, they said to choose the min patch level for the Origin or the firmware on the device, and that this is device specific, although I’ve found this is not always consistent and EFOTA itself won’t even allow you to download some origins.

 

There is a second A15 update for the S24, but EFOTA will not allow me to choose the Origin as the one before. An earlier version as the Origin downloads

but gives me an error when assigned to the device.

 

A similar issue arises with the S23, but the update works for the devices that had the older firmware (2023-09-01) for example, but not the updated device (2024-11-01) going to A15.

 

I will attach snips, the input and scenario. Devices are remote and I cannot get dumpstates, although as soon as I assign the campaign to that device it gets flagged so I don't think we need to do anything with the device.

 

 


Thanks,

 

Martel

Subject: Invalid firmware
Description__c:
This relates to a previous case: 00240095


It was stated that the device was from a firmware version that was never intended for release and therefore has no upgrade available.

I have since realised that we have another device with the same error but on a different Android Security Patch level:


The device we investigated was:

353228110354909 – Security patch 2019-10-01


Another device with the same error:

350346012947787 - Security patch 2020-09-01


Does that mean there could be multiple firmware versions that were not intended for release?


We have received a list of devices from our reseller that were in the same batch as the original dodgy one but many of these are up to date!

I suspect that a batch of dodgy devices from Samsung may not have been kept together at the reseller and therefore may be across multiple orders mixed with healthy devices.


I need to find a way of identifying which devices are affected so we can start the remediation.


​​​​​​​Please can you advise if there is any other way of identifying them?


Thank you

James

Subject: "Postpone" update policy issue on Samsung devices
Description__c:
Hello Samsung,


We have an ongoing issue with FOTA updates of our Samsung devices. 

We are not using Knox E-FOTA, but AE System update policy. For that we use Microsoft Intune and we set up the "postponed" policy for the system updates in the Android configuration profile.


The "postpone" does not work as intended, devices seem to only update the counter after 30 days (that it checked for new update), but it never asks for update installation nor installs any update. We got this reported from devices that were not updated for few months because of this issue, even though there were updates released for these devices during that time period.


I was able to reproduce the issue on my SM-T225 tablet. For the reproduction I set up the "postponed" policy on 25/07 and checking it today on 25/08 I can see that there is an information in Settings > Software update that the device last checked for update today [see screenshot], BUT there was no attempt from the device side to install the update nor to notify me that the installation is possible. Attaching the log folder - dumpstate taken after the repro.


This is a serious blocker for us and we already reported this issue to Microsoft. Their statement was that this has been aknowledged by Google and Samsung and that a fix for that will be released in August update for Samsung devices.


Best Regards.

Michal Klimek

ISS World Services

Subject: Potential false positive we are reaching out to Samsung support E-FOTA Not enough storage space on the device to download firmware.
Description__c:
Hello,


We are encountering an issue with firmware deployment via E-FOTA for approximately 39 devices.


The E-FOTA console displays the error message "Not enough storage space on the device to download firmware" for these devices.

However, KAI (Knox Asset Intelligence) and Workspace One, indicate that these devices have sufficient available memory to accommodate the firmware installation.


This discrepancy suggests a potential issue with how E-FOTA is assessing device storage or a conflict with its download process.


Could you please investigate this matter and provide guidance on resolving the "Not enough storage space" error in E-FOTA, given that other tools report adequate memory?


Please review attached csv file with a report of all devices actively in the state Not enough storage space.


Thank you for your assistance.

Subject: RestrictionPolicy.allowFirmwareRecovery(boolean) API not preventing flash
Description__c:
Device Model correct: The device is actually a Galaxy Tab S4 (Model: SM-T835) running Android 8.1.0, but the dropdown model box when creating this case did not have this model available for selection.


A customer reported that they're pen testers were able to root a device through firmware recovery mechanism after sending a configuration to the device telling the Agent to use the RestrictionPolicy.allowFirmwareRecovery(boolean) API (https://seap.samsung.com/api-references/android/reference/com/samsung/android/knox/restriction/RestrictionPolicy.html#allowFirmwareRecovery(boolean)).


I validated that we call the API through the Knox SDK. I saw some specific logs, but not sure if that's why the device is not enforcing the API.


Here, Agent is applying restriction.

09-26 15:18:26.489 3009-10832/com.airwatch.androidagent D/AirWatch: Samsung : Method available= allowFirmwareRecovery


Samsung's API handler acknowledges that it received the configuration for us not to allow (note: allow - false)

09-26 15:18:26.494 1573-2498/? D/RestrictionPolicy: allowFirmwareRecovery :oldState - true, allow - false


Samsung SDK acknowledges

09-26 15:18:26.497 1573-2002/? D/[KnoxAnalyticsSDK]: feature = API_USAGE

schemaVersion = 1

event = RestrictionPolicy.allowFirmwareRecovery

payload = Bundle[{pN=com.airwatch.androidagent, ons=1, ReservedKey_UserId_UserTypeFlag=0}]

timestamp = 1537988400000

eventId = 0


This seems to represent the final state, but it's true, instead of false... (I assume it's the final state)

09-26 15:18:26.498 1573-2498/? D/RestrictionPolicy: allowFirmwareRecovery : true


With that said, it appears to not set the restriction and if it is setting the restriction, the pen tester is still able to root the device through recovery.


I've attached the bug report and device properties

Subject: Knox service plugin does not apply APN policy on samsung devices after recent firmware update on phones
Description__c:
Hi, We deploy the knox service plugin with intune on our samsung xcover 5 phones. The problem that has appered in the last 10 days is that when the phones updated to version G525FXXU8CWH1 /G525FOXM8CWH1 / G525FXXU8CWH1 the APN policy that is configured in the knox service plugin does not take effect. i have tested the same setup on a Samsung A52 and the same problem occur. When i use a Samsung xcover 5 or 4s that has not recived that update the policy is applied. i created a configuration with less policies too see if that helped with the APN policy but no change. In the knox service plugin app it says that all policies were successfully completed, but there are no changes. Only the default APN from our service provider appear not our own. The sim cards i am using have all been in use up to this update. i have uploaded the received policies and configuration reports. i hope this will be solved fast because this will effect a large part of our users when the samsung devices updates. If you need anymore information do not hesitate to contact me.


Sincerely,

Nicholas

Subject: Firmware downgrade mechanism for Samsung devices (Reference: Case #00167750)
Description__c:
Hi,

We had raised Case #00167750 sometime back to find out if there is a way to perform Firmware downgrades on Samsung devices. Now, we have a follow-up question that you can hopefully answer for us.


There is this line as one of the responses in Case 00167750 (Thiago 22/5/2019 7:09 PM):

"Regarding the Knox warranty, you will not void it as long you install an official Samsung binary. But as the downgrade process is not supported, errors can happen and cause the Knox warranty bit to be set."


Let us assume we try a downgrade and an error occurs - resulting in the Knox warranty to be voided. Now, if we try one more firmware downgrade / upgrade, will the Knox warranty be restored assuming the downgrade / upgrade that we tried the second time succeeded?


Thank you,

Bala

Subject: OTA Firmware Update Not Blocked
Description__c:
Hi Team,


We have a production issue with Verizon Samsung Galaxy Tab A8's being prompted for Firmware update and is impacting our business. Specific firmware upgrades (in attachment) are found to have GPS coordinate mis-alignment issues causing speed lock issues in our trucks while tablet is not in motion. Supplying information collected thus far. Please investigate and advise.


WM Digital Team Feedback for Bad Firmware (See BAD FW attachment for details)

We are working on this issue continuously. We have analyzed this issue and found that even in Stationary Mode the GPS points are received with Speed greater than 7 MPH.


To fix this issue we are trying to incorporate some additional logic to identify when the device is stationary by using device Sensors. 


Recent Finding as of 08/20

Tablets are being prompted for Firmware update although OS updates are being blocked via Samsung KNOX KC and MobiControl (See .msg attachment with issue reported to SOTI Support Team)

Subject: Behavior of system updates
Description__c: Dear customer support,

Subject: [AU800] Lynk CLOUD firmware update (OTN) not working
Description__c:
Dear team,

 

I would like to report issue described below.

 

Title: [AU800] Lynk CLOUD firmware update (OTN) not working

 

​

Devices: HG55AU800EUXEN

 

​

Description: The issue started with customer reporting that Lynk CLOUD project > promotion > View Details button shows nothing when you press it, the issue was supposed to be fixed via new firmware release for HAU800 series TVs (according to HQ/Manoj), however, customer reported that 53 of their TVs are not updating the firmware to latest release automatically via OTN method even though all TVs are connected to internet and to Lynk CLOUD, in addition to "OTN Update" option is enabled via TVs' hotel menu.

 

​

Actions by 4i:

- Checked OTN Update option is enabled

- Asked customer to send "TV Firmware Auto Update: On" and run it immediately on TVs (via Lynk CLOUD) - no success

- Asked customer to trigger OTN firmware update by turning off the TVs for 5+ minutes and then turning them on - customer had TVs switched Off for a day or longer but firmware update wasn't triggered.

 

​

Expectations: AU800 HTVs to be able to update firmware automatically to latest release through OTN in order to fix "View Details" option issue

 

​

Actual result: AU800 HTVs are not updating to latest firmware release automatically

 

Attachments: Field checklist, image showing "TV info", "TV FW ON command" screenshot, Image showing "View Details option", "Video showing View Details option pressed but not showing anything", "Video showing customer deploying promotion on TV", and "HAU800 TVs FW version from Lynk CLOUD" image. All attached in the "Related" tab.

 

Thank you in advance.

 

Best regards,

Subject: Firmware Update b2b API request does not work
Description__c:
Dear Support!


We are trying to implement remote firmware update to the above mentioned TV model + FW version but when we send the API request, we get a success response and the TV does not update its firmware.


var onSuccess = function(val) {

 console.log("[updateFirmware] success : " + val); 

 };

var onError = function(error) {

 console.log("[updateFirmware] code :" + error.code + " error name: " + error.name + " message " + error.message);

 };

var SoftwareID = "0";

var SWUFileName = "upgrade.bem";

var SWVersion = "T-HKMLAKUC 0227.20";

var SWURL = "http://IP/T-HKMLAKUC_0227_20/image/upgrade.bem";

var SWTotalBytes = 1007396825;


b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(SoftwareID, SWUFileName, SWVersion, SWURL, SWTotalBytes, onSuccess, onError);


--> this is the API request we are using. We have a file on our server called update.json with following contents:


   "firmware": {

    "softwareID": "2200",

    "swuFileName": "swuimage.bem",

    "swVersion": "T-NKLADEUCB 2200.9",

    "swUrl": "http://10.249.68.201/tizen_config/swuimage.bem",

  },

And in the API request, we of course use the correct property values, like swTotalBytes or SWVersion, etc.

Could you please help us with this issue? We would really appreciate it!

We are looking forward for you answer!


-Regards

customer pending

Green

100%

When a new firmware update is installed, Google Play is also updated if a new version is available.
