Subject: [ETS] RRF carrier bundle support in XCover6 Pro firmware
Description__c:
Hello,


For the purpose of RRF project, a test ROM (based on Android 14) was generated for the XCover6 Pro and incorporating the specific RRF network parameters of RRF MVNO (ACMOSS).

These configuration parameters (APN settings and IMS configuration) are again provided as an attachement to this case and for reference.


This test ROM software is currently being tested at Airbus side.

Initial findings have already been shared with SEF team, in particular the finding on the UI side with RRF SIM inserted inside the device.


In particular, it was found that:

  1. APN settings are correct for the DATA and CBS APN. However the IP address (Proxy MMS) for the MMS APN was missing.
  2. The DATA APN is not selected by default on the device (but this might be normal as long as the device is not attached to the eNB)
  3. The IMS APN we indicated as visible (but not editable) in the configuration file is not visible on the screen
  4. The VoLTE and VoIMS settings are not visible either in the device settings


Device information:


  • AP : G736BXXU5DWJ8_T
  • CP : G736BXXU5DWJ8
  • CSC : G736BOXM5DWJ8
  • Model : SM-G736B/DS


This case has been opened to follow up these issues and in particular to get feedbacks on these findings and a guarantee that the corrections (e.g. correction for MMS APN) will be made in the official production S/W planned for Feb. 2024.


Thank you for your feedback.


Br, Herve

Subject: Firmware Update b2b API request does not work
Description__c:
Dear Support!


We are trying to implement remote firmware update to the above mentioned TV model + FW version but when we send the API request, we get a success response and the TV does not update its firmware.


var onSuccess = function(val) {

 console.log("[updateFirmware] success : " + val); 

 };

var onError = function(error) {

 console.log("[updateFirmware] code :" + error.code + " error name: " + error.name + " message " + error.message);

 };

var SoftwareID = "0";

var SWUFileName = "upgrade.bem";

var SWVersion = "T-HKMLAKUC 0227.20";

var SWURL = "http://IP/T-HKMLAKUC_0227_20/image/upgrade.bem"";

var SWTotalBytes = 1007396825;


b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(SoftwareID, SWUFileName, SWVersion, SWURL, SWTotalBytes, onSuccess, onError);


--> this is the API request we are using. We have a file on our server called update.json with following contents:


   "firmware": {

    "softwareID": "2200",

    "swuFileName": "swuimage.bem",

    "swVersion": "T-NKLADEUCB 2200.9",

    "swUrl": "http://10.249.68.201/tizen_config/swuimage.bem"",

    "swTotalBytes": 1518073464

  },

  "app_path": {

    "url_launcher_path": "http://10.249.68.201/ONEsquareX""

  }


And in the API request, we of course use the correct property values, like swTotalBytes or SWVersion, etc.


But when we send the request, it calls the success callback. But nothing happens on the TV. We tried sending the getFirmware request to see if the FW version changed but it did not.


Could you please help us with this issue? Why is the response always success even if we send gibberish data?

We would really appreciate your help since we've been stuck with this for more than a week. We created a ticket for this before but unfortunately it gets ignored.


We already did logs, where we mapped the firmware update function to a key on the remote so that I could trigger it manually.


Then I triggered it two times, first time with SoftwareID = “0” and the second time with SoftwareID = “2200”

Both times I saw no UI response or any logs and the API call responded with success.


I will attached the logs.


(Just to clarify, model number: HG50NJ690UFXZA

Serial number: 07L53CXKC00050J

Firmware: T-KTM2AKUCB-1340.1)


We are looking forward for you answer!!


-Regards

Subject: Remote firmware update
Description__c:
Good morning, we are trying to remotely update the display's firmware.

We are currently using b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware function passing as parameters

​

var SoftwareID = "0";

var SWUFileName = "swuimage.bem";

var SWVersion = "T-KTM2ELAKUC-2430.3";

var SWURL = "https://sample2.livesignage.xyz/ssspupd/swuimage.bem";

var SWTotalBytes = 1260238280;

​

and we set a change listener.

The update function response is success but after that the onchange function won't be invoked and seems like nothing it's happening.

We try waiting for more than an hour but still nothing.

​

There's some parameters we need to change? We are doing something wrong?

​

Here's our complete function call:


var SoftwareID = "0";

var SWUFileName = "swuimage.bem";

var SWVersion = "T-KTM2ELAKUC-2430.3";

var SWURL = "https://sample2.livesignage.xyz/ssspupd/swuimage.bem";

var SWTotalBytes = 1260238280;

try{

b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware(

SoftwareID,

SWUFileName,

SWVersion,

SWURL,

SWTotalBytes,

(res)=>{

console.log("onSuccess")

console.log(res);

var onchange = function(data) {

console.log("[UpdateFirmwareProgressChangedCallback] progress :" + data + " changed");

}

try {

b2bapis.b2bcontrol.setUpdateFirmwareProgressChangeListener(onchange);

} catch (e) { b2bapis.b2bcontrol.unsetUpdateFirmwareProgressChangeListener();

console.log("setUpdateFirmwareListener exception [" + e.code + "] name: " + e.name + " message: " + e.message);

}

},

(err)=>{

console.log("onError")

console.log(err);

});

}catch(e){

console.log("UPDATE FIRMWARE ERROR: ")

console.log(e);

}


Thanks,

Ruggero Barsacchi

Subject: [B2B/X200/웅진씽크빅] allowFirmwareRecovery Knox API 동작 시 ProKiosk 관련 문의

안녕하세요, 하기 문의드립니다.

allowFirmwareRecovery Knox API를 통해 이를 block 하고자 합니다.

 

setProkioskState false 상태에서도 이 동작이 유지되는지 확인 부탁드립니다.

감사합니다.

Attachments: pictures of the MENU before and after updating the firmware


Thank you in advance.

Natalia

Description__c:
=============Ticket is created under customer's behalf==============


Hi team,


Customer is reporting that there is a device accidentally updated to O10, meanwhile the device is registered to E-FOTA and all OS10 is not in active status.


After we analyzed the log, these are our finding.


First boot after FR:

2020-07-09 14:13:43 | LPM | RP | G970FXXS3ASJG / OFFSRC: - / ONSRC: PWRON / RSTSTAT: SWRESET


Last update SWMA by KC:

LastUpdateTime=2020-07-14 19:12:02

InstallerPackageName=com.sec.knox.kccagent


And afterwards, we found the firmware update journey update below:

2020-07-17 10:20:50 | ON | NP | G970FXXS3ASJG / OFFSRC: PWRHOLD / ONSRC: PWRON / RSTSTAT: PINRESET RSVD30


Update from G970FXXS3ASJG to G970FXXU3BSKO

2020-07-17 10:45:43+0800 | ON | RP | G970FXXU3BSKO / OFFSRC: - / ONSRC: PWRON / RSTSTAT: SWRESET


Update from G970FXXU3BSKO to G970FXXU7CTF1

2020-07-17 11:05:57+0800 | ON | RP | G970FXXU7CTF1 / OFFSRC: - / ONSRC: PWRON / RSTSTAT: SWRESET



The E-FOTA status on the device now is ENABLED.


Would appreciate your help to check on this issue.

Thank you


Best regards,

Dineta

Subject: Same Model, firmware, OS and JavaSCript Player (widget) behve complete different
Description__c:
Hi!



A customer from us likes to use our JavaScript Player for digital signage.


Our screen/player works like expected and plays the assigned content. But the customers screen has troubles with the download. Some files will be downloaded, some break all the time so they will not removed from the queue and the download starts over and over again.


There are two reasons why the download fail:

  • File size not correct. We have a simple validation check included. We check the file size on disk with the file size passed by the CMS.
  • Common error


Furthermore, I noticed that the JavaScript player is restarting many times. Like every 30 seconds. And I have not figured out why this is happening beacuse the log files look good to me.


I have checked that we have the same model, firmware, OS version (buildVersion of system information) and player version. We both are using the player with a network cable. So to me there are no differences but our customer is not happy with his faulty player


Can you imagine whats happening here. Are the screens still different?



Kind regards,

Christoph

Subject: Unable to deploy TV configuration via Lynk Cloud / firmware
Description__c:
Dear team,

Trust this message finds you well. I'd like to bring a case with one of our partners to your attention.

 

Title of the issue:

 

 

Description of the issue:

Our partner has 8 TV's model HAU8000(43"). Four of them have firmware T-NKLADEUCB-2201.0 (1.3.0621), and the other four have firmware T-NKLADEUCB-2201.0 (0.1.4021). He has no problem with deployment of TV configuration from Lynk Cloud to TVs with firmware T-NKLADEUCB-2201.0 (1.3.0621), but deployment to TVs with firmware T-NKLADEUCB-2201.0 (0.1.4021) is pending. See the attached file (screenshots from Lynk Cloud).

Our partner can't deploy TV settings from Lynk Cloud to some (4) TVs. He's followed all the instructions received from us so far but without success. He tried to update the firmware via USB stick with the file received from us as well as via OTN, but always gets a message that the update is not available. He can transfer the settings via USB stick normally, but not via Lynk Cloud. Their assumption is in the firmware because the version of the TVs that he can deploy [T-NKLADEUCB-2201.0 (1.3.0621)] extension at the end differs from the firmware version of the TVs that he cannot deploy [T-NKLADEUCB-2201.0 (0.1.4021)].

 

What troubleshoots we have tried:

1. We have checked the exact model code to be sure we are not mixing with regions or different model code specifics.

2. Clone file from the devices which are being able to update from LynkCloud was cloned and tried to be imported via USB on the issued devices, unfortunately the updating process via LynkCloud still not finished.

 

What is the Expected result:

 

Being able to update firmware via LynkCloud

What is the Actual Result:

Subject: Firmware Upgrade intern DNS doesn't work
Description__c:
Hello

Which this Firmware updates:

G525FXXS5AVD1/G525FOXM5AVD1/G525FXXS5AVD1 Security Patch 01.04.2022

G525FXXU5AVC1/G525FOXM5AVC1/G525FXXU5AVC1 Security Patch 01.03.2022

G525FXXS5AVB3/G525FOXM5AVB3/G525FXXS5AVB3 Security Patch 01.02.2022

G525FXXU5AUL3/G525FOXM5AUL4/G525FXXU5AUL3 Security Patch 01.01.2022

since we update this Firmware Versions the Smartphones can't connect to our internal DNS. with this Firmwares the DNS entry is not relevant and we can't connect with the Smartphone App Jabber Client in the Wifi to the CIsco Server which works in our internal network or we can't connect to an internal Webserver. But with the old Firmware version "G525FXXU4AUI2/G525FOXM4AUI2/G525FXXU4AUI2 Security Patch 01.09.2021" it works.


We set the DNS entry by manual on the Smartphone but with the newer Firmware it would be ignored.


Could you help us? We are a hospital and the phone are really important for us. Know we can't do a downgrade from the Firmware version and it's really important to reach the Cisco Server in the internal network.


kind regards.

Subject: Programmatic upgrade of the firmware
Description__c:
Hello,

we are having troubles understanding b2bapis.b2bcontrol.updateFirmware() function. We are trying to implement programmatic firmware upgrade, but input parameters for the function are completely mysterious:


SoftwareID -> what is this?

SWUFileName -> is it just a filename (last part of the url)?

SWVersion -> is it the firmware version like T-HKMLODWWC-2140.3? why is it needed here?

SWURL so url or path? in example it is a remote file, can it be https://sth.sth/firmware/sth.bem?? or it should already be downloaded to the internal memory?

   string,software file path


currently when invoking on target device with parameters updateFirmware("0", "update.bem", "T-HKMLODWWC-2140.3", "our https url to the firmware file", size in bytes, callback) app crashes, and then is started one more time. No error nor success is reported.

Which this Firmware updates:

G525FXXU5AVC1/G525FOXM5AVC1/G525FXXU5AVC1 Security Patch 01.03.2022

since we update this Firmware Versions the Smartphones can't connect to our internal DNS. with this Firmwares the DNS entry is not relevant and we can't connect with the Smartphone App Jabber Client in the Wifi to the CIsco Server which works in our internal network or we can't connect to an internal Webserver. We set the DNS entry by manual on the Smartphone but with the newer Firmware it would be ignored.


Could you help us? We are a hospital and the phone are really important for us. Know we can't do a downgrade from the Firmware version and it's really important to reach the Cisco Server in the internal network.


kind regards.

Subject: Disable firmware update via Recovery Mode
Description__c:
Hi,


We are trying to disable all possibilities of reprogramming and updating firmware via Recovery Mode and Download Mode using RestrictionPolicy.allowFirmwareRecovery().

https://docs.samsungknox.com/devref/knox-sdk/reference/com/samsung/android/knox/restriction/RestrictionPolicy.html#allowFirmwareRecovery(boolean)


As the description of the API states, it seems to disable programming/updating via Download Mode. However, it still seems to be possible to program/update firmware via Recovery Mode. Due to the APIs name, we thought that this functionality also would be blocked.


I have attached a couple of pictures taken when the device is in Recovery Mode after the restriction policy had been set.


Is the API intended to block firmware programming/updating via Recover Mode? If not, is there any other way to achieve this?


Best regards,

Johan

Subject: [FER][ETS] Firmware Release Dashboard
Description__c:
Please provide a detailed description of your request. Please add as much detail as possible, including the problem the customer wants to solve with the requested solution. This will help us better understand the context and request. Additional materials can be uploaded as follows:


- Problem / Pain point:

Currently, EFOTA only provides a very difficult way to view firmware update information for our registered Samsung mobile devices

  • The overview is only accessible by going into each individual device detail page in a campaign
  • To find out which updates are available for a specific model and you must open each device individually and manually select "select a firmware".
  • With 30+ registered models, this process is time-consuming, inefficient, and lacks clarity.
  • There is no centralized search or filter function that allows quick lookup of models and their update histories.
  • This significantly complicates planning and monitoring of update rollouts and security patches.


- Expected result:


  • Develop a user-friendly, centralized search or overview page within EFOTA (access within the Knox Suite)
  • Ability to search directly by model number or model name and get a list of all registered devices.
  • For each model, display current (and past) firmware version, release date, OS version and security patch level like in the screenshot attached
  • Provide filtering options by the column name
  • Export function should be possible (csv / xlsx)
  • The goal is to drastically reduce the effort required for update monitoring and provide a quick overview of the update status for all devices.

Subject: Failure in doing remote firmware upgrade
Description__c:
We're attempting to remotely upgrade the firmware of screens but it's failing. We've managed to recreate the issue on our TV in the office (or at least we think it's the same problem) so have collected debug information for that TV.


The DM32E TV is currently running T-GFSLE2AKUC-1044.0 and we're attempting to upgrade it to T-GFSLE2AKUC_1046.1 using DBE_DME_DHE_UDE-P_DME-BR_T-GFSLE2AKUC_1046.1_BEM.zip. When doing upgrade we change the URL launcher so that it loads a different application (see the attachment main.zip). This downloads the content from our server and attempts to upgrade it.


I've attached a video of the what the TV shows (DSCF0793.MP4). It downloads the file off the server and then starts the upgrade but shortly afterwards displays a message saying "No valid update files found, please check your USB device and try again".


We tried doing the upgrade with a debug cable attached but got nothing useful so instead got the TV to write the debug logs to the USB which I have attached to this ticket as epcontrol.zip.


Do you know why the TV may be failing to upgrade? Are we using the wrong firmware for the TV or is it something we're doing wrong in the application? Is there any way we can get better debug information through our app to explain to us what the problem is?


Thanks!

Subject: [QMR] Firmware Bug-Meldung
Description__c:
GENERAL/REQUEST INFORMATION:

- *Problem Description: Kunde meldet einen Bug in der neuen Firmware.

- Customer Request:

 

Ich möchte euch informieren, dass mit der neuen Samsung Firmware «T-KTM2ELAKUC 2220.5» bei den Display QM32R und QR43R folgendes Problem gibt:

 

Diverse Screens zeigen nur noch grauen Inhalt an, anstelle des eigentlichen Inhalts (Bild, welches über URL gezogen wird)

Nach Reboot wird richtiger Inhalt (Bild von URL) wieder angezeigt, jedoch erscheint grauer Inhalt nach einiger Zeit wieder

Analyse hat ergeben, dass wenn man den Cache über den Server mit der Fernbedienung löscht (siehe Anhang) funktioniert es wieder für eine gewisse Zeit und dann gibt es wieder mit dem Cache Probleme. Aus diesem Grund können dann die URLs etc. nicht dargestellt werden.

 

Mit der speziellen Downgrade Software, die wir von euch erhalten haben funktionieren die Displays wieder einwandfrei.

 

https://sesg.sharefile.com/d-seb79ebd4a7a245c8915038907f87405e

 

Wichtig diese FW steht unter NDA und darf ausschliesslich für diesen Fall benutzt werden.

Subject: Horizontal playback regression with firmware 1070.31
Description__c:
After reporting case 252032 (vertical playback regression with Tizen 6.5), I have received firmware 1070.31 for testing. The experimental firmware fixes the playback regression when using portrait content but introduces a new regression for landscape content:

Case 252032 was visible when preloading a video while playing back a video on our HTML5 JavaScript player on Tizen 6.5

With firmware 1070.31 if the screen is set the horizontal mode, preloading of a video while playing back a video leads to a persistent issue (until the next reboot) where 50% of the screen is green, I will attach a screenshot.

The problem is that we have no firmware downgrade version, so if a customer who uses landscape playback updates to a firmware version containing the regression we are in real trouble.

Subject: The firmware that is selected will not be installed
Description__c:
the following problem exists:


in E-FOTA this firmware is assigned: AP Version "G525FXXUADXE1", CP Version "G525FXXUADXCB", CSC Version "G525FOXMADXE2", Release Date "2024-05-20 13:55:13", OS Version "U(Android 14) " with the last Security Patch "2024-04-01".


But a different version with the camera problem is installed.

This firmware is installed:

G525FXXUADXD3, G525FXXUADXCB, G525FOXMADXD3, 2024-04-23 12:11:48 , U(Android 14), 2024-04-01.


The incorrect version is installed even though the new version was selected where the problem should be solved.


After installing the faulty firmware Android 14 with security patch "2024-04-01" the request for installing the security patch, release date (2024-05-20 13:55:13) appears. After this installation the problem with the camera will be solved.


Installing Android 14 takes at least 35 minutes. The second installation of the security patch takes at least 6 minutes. In total we have a downtime of at least 41 minutes.


We expect that the solution to the camera problem will be included in the latest release. That's why we skip the release with the problem.


After installing the version with the camera problem, you will be asked to install the release that solves the problem.


According to our ideas, this must be included as selected in the Android 14 release "2024-05-20 13:55:13". But it's not.


Please store this accordingly so that we do not require users to install twice.

Description__c:
Hello team,

 

I hope you're doing well.

 

NOTE: I searched "CSC TELECOM" account name, and I found 3 options from Latvia and Lithuania, however, the customer who reported this case is from Estonia.

 

I would like to report the case described below:

 

Devices: 2x PH49F

 

Description: Cutsomer has 2 PH49F S4 devices connected to MagicInfo 9 server 21.1040.2, they are having issues publishing a PPTX file which lead them to trying to update the FW to the latest release in hope that it will resolve the issue.

However, from MagicInfo server the screens show the SUB-MICOM version (T-HKMLFWWS-1000) instead of the firmware version (T-HKMLAKUC-2004.2).

 

"Device_info_from_MagicInfo" screenshot attached.

"How_the_firmware_version_appear_on_MagicInfo" screenshot attached.

 

But physically from the screen via Menu > Support > Contact Samsung, the firmware version is visible (devices' info images attached).

 

Actions by 4i:

- Provided USB version of two different firmware releases (2160.1 and 2140.1), but customer was unable to update and there was an error on the screen. ("Error_when_trying_to_update_via_USB" image attached).

- Asked customer to connect both devices to our test server in order to try to update the firmware, however, I was NOT able to find the devices in the list of available devices for update ("Can't_find_the_PH49F_devices_to_update_firmware_via_MIS" image attached).

- Asked customer to try and access factory menu (Mute182PowerOn), but the key combination didn't work for customer after several attempts.

 

Expectations: To be able to update the firmware on 2x PH49F screens

 

Actual result: Unable to update firmware on 2x PH49F (with BEM and USB).

 

Attachments: Field checklist + images and screenshots are attached in the "Related" tab.

 

Thank you in advance.

 

Best regards,

Subject: Unable to download System Updates
Description__c:
I have Samsung XCover6 Pro (SM-G736U) phones, and I'm currently experimenting with a profile on my Samsung Knox Manage account IT Admin Profile with a single device on it. This device is still on Android 13, with the last Android Security Patch level from May 1, 2023. I've checked my carrier's software updates that are available for my phone here: https://www.att.com/device-support/article/wireless/000094293/Samsung/SamsungSMG736U/ . Which says it has system updates upgrading to Android 14 and the latest update is from June 2024, so I know there are system software updates available.


On the IT Admin Profile in Knox Manage, under Android Enterprise > System > System Updates, I originally had the setting there set to Automatic, with no freeze period set. When I try to update the Android system software on my phone by going to Settings > Software Update and tapped on Check for update, it starts to check for updates, and a notification at the top of the phone appears that says "checking DM server", and shortly after this a page comes up that says "Software Update Interrupted, Software updates are controlled by your organization. Contact your IT administrator for more information". This is where it stops, and no updates are available to be applied.


I changed the policy and also set the System Update to no setting, which should allow the phone to manually update, and I pushed the policy to the phone, and still had the same behavior as described above.


Am I missing some other setting somewhere in Knox Manage that is stopping Android software updates from being found and applied to the phone?


Thank you.

Subject: built-in VPN broken after Google Play system update
Description__c:
An IPSec/IKEv2 RSA VPN does not work once the Google Play system update of 1 July (24.22.13 (190400-683740827)) is applied to the devices. Doing a packet capture, I can see traffic reaching the internal network through the VPN tunnel and going back to the mobile devices, the VPN tunnel interface appears to be dropping the packets.


Other users seem to be having this issue too: https://r2.community.samsung.com/t5/Galaxy-S/VPN-broken-on-S21-FE-5G-G990B-after-Security-Update/td-p/16578138/highlight/true

Subject: Need to downgrade firmware versions to 1130.23 or better 1120.7
Description__c:
Hi,


I'm currently involved with Kamil Rozbicki in ticket 00296501. I observed an issue present in firmware 1120.7, he asked me to check if it was still present in 1130.23 – and now he provided a link to a test firmware that should fix the issue, requesting me to try it out on my device.


He also asked me to open this ticket.


The problem is: While the mentioned device is my lab unit, we have plenty of identical devices on the TUI MeinSchiff7 cruise ship, as we are TUIC's technical partner. Those production devices all run firmware 1120.7 at the moment. While we are indeed able to update firmwares remotely, this isn't something we like to do lightly over the air (i.e. over satellite internet connection). At the moment, we have found a workaround to circumvent the issue stated in ticket 00296501.


As you can imagine, it is crucial for me to be able to have my lab device running the exact same firmware as our customers' production units on the cruise ship. While I am definitely able and willing to install test firmwares to assist your tech team, I need to be able to downgrade my firmware to the version running on our customers' production devices.


Please provide a way to install older firmwares (preferably 1120.7) so I will be able to downgrade after checking out with the experimental test firmware.


Thanks a lot in advance,

Gero Zahn

Subject: Reopening 00291036 -- 1060.1 firmware version.
Description__c:
Please refer back to the 00291036 for reproduction steps. I just realized we started deploying this to hardware out in the field and this firmware breaks offline comms.


From email chain with Jorge Hernandez titled: "[00277613] - Lag and eventual freeze behavior in Kiosk device when using RM function"


"I've attached videos demonstrating the local network issues on both fw 1060.11 and fw 1020 for your review.

 

Local network issue fw1060.11 (Test firmware, but same behavior on 1060.1)

In this firmware version, you may need to wait for approximately 30-90 seconds until the toast notification about cable connectivity appears. 

Once the notification is displayed, communication with the Kiosk becomes unavailable.

 

Local network fw1020

In this firmware version, no toast notification is shown when the main internet supply is disconnected. 

The kiosk can continue to communicate with all local network devices."


In case the links are broken:

1060.11: https://drive.google.com/file/d/168B0XXQQfQxkcaxAkzjF9gWKkA9VR-aI/view


1020: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uNh448119YFZKU1o_-7oGGI6GI4wN8lp/view



Please try to reproduce similar to what the above videos show. If that doesn't work please launch an app from Tizen studio while opening up remote web inspector and then note the disconnection on 1060.1 firmwares compared to 1020.5, 1030, 1040.1.
